subject: Re: [junit] RFA - Seeking information for University Report  on Open-Source
msgSnippet: ... If you re not locked into that thesis, also consider HTMLUnit, which does much of what HTTPUnit does, but differently. ... As a community we are still
messageBody:
>So said Edwin Sillence on 2003-06-02 --------------------
>Hi,
>
>I am currently writing an academic report (for the University of
>Technology, Sydney) on the topic / hypothesis:
>
>"The open source unit-testing framework consisting of (JUnit, HttpUnit and
>JUnitPerf) is a practical means of Performance testing web-based Java
>applications."

If you're not locked into that thesis, also consider HTMLUnit, which does much of what HTTPUnit does, but differently.

>My report requires a review of the existing literature but I have been
>having a certain amount of difficulty since the topic is a little obscure
>/ specific.

As a community we are still preoccupied with behavioral testing of web applications (correctness testing) and so there isn't the critical mass of literature specifically on performance testing.

>I was wondering whether anyone could direct me to any data, information,
>reports or academic assesments of these three tools and their use in
>performance testing (of any web-based application is good, but preference
>for Java involvement).

You may find only anecdotal reports.

>Also, academic works on closely related areas would be thankfully received
>as well.

Best of luck, and I'm sorry I don't have more for you.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
telephone: +1 416 791-8603
